content: I think it's IMAP - there's a folder in the Profile called ImapMail Thanks.
creator: carla33

content:
An IMAP account mirrors what's present on your Email provider's server. Unless you make offline copies of those emails, they are subject to deletion and addition as and when you - or your provider - alter the contents of the folders.

Have you checked your online interface to see if the emails are present?

btw, I have an IMAPMail folder in my profile, too, but I run POP. The account type is displayed in 'Server Settings' under the account in 'Account Settings'.
creator: frisée

content:
First thing to check would be whether your messages are still on the server, which you can do using the webmail interface of your e-mail provider. In the case of Gandi, you can find it here:

https://webmail.gandi.net/

I stopped using Gandi some time ago because of their outrageous e-mail prices, but used it in the past (when prices were reasonable) and can tell you the two webmail options provided (SOGo and Roundcube) have similar functionality. Choosing one over the other is a matter of personal preference and either one will allow you to see whether the messages are still there.

content: Thanks for getting back to me so quickly. Unfortunately the stores passwords shown are only for my Gmail accounts and the outlook email doesn't appear for some strange reason. Any other thoughts or suggestions?
creator: mikegibb32

content:
Mike Gibb said
Thanks for getting back to me so quickly. Unfortunately the stores passwords shown are only for my Gmail accounts and the outlook email doesn't appear for some strange reason. Any other thoughts or suggestions?

You will need to set up outgoing and incoming servers with correct authentication and server names. You are probably trying to send Outlook email through the gmail servers.

For example, set up a new server in the Outgoing Server settings: Hamburger (top right)/Account Settings/Outgoing Server (SMTP) (left) then link the server by using the settings in the 'Account Settings' for that Email provider.

content:
Here are the proper steps to transfer. Please review and compare to whatever you did. Here is the link for moving a profile in Windows when installed in default location: 

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer

here is the info in brief steps:

  1. ensure thunderbird is NOT running on old machine
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media
  5. ensure thunderbird is installed on second computer and NOT running
  6. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  7. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This may prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it
  8. start thunderbird and all should be there
